abstract: As mainland China’s mainland exchanges get bigger, Hong Kong can’t count on winning prize listings forever; it’s time for a Plan B, Breakingviews says.
snippet: As mainland China’s mainland exchanges get bigger, Hong Kong can’t count on winning prize listings forever; it’s time for a Plan B, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: The Hong Kong Stock Exchange is the world’s second-biggest by market capitalization. Call it the China factor. Yet as the mainland’s own exchanges get bigger, Hong Kong can’t count on winning prize listings forever; it’s time for a Plan B, Breakingviews says.

headline.main: A Plan B for Hong Kong’s Stock Exchange?
